item.title: 'The Liberation of Sita' By Volga - Thoughts and Notes
item.description: Thoughts Does Ramayana qualify for a feminist fiction? For argument’s sake, lets consider Ramayana is a true story. Post Ram and Sita’s homecoming, Sita was asked to give a chastity test, and she left the palace after proving herself. She could have left without undergoing the test but then the crowd would have believed that indeed she was at fault. Being a woman and fighting for yourself in those ages is feministic (and applause worthy).
